verses.verse: He, that being often reproved <S%H8433><s%> hardens <S%H7185><s%> his neck, <S%H6203><s%> shall suddenly <S%H6621><s%> be destroyed, <S%H7665><s%> and that without <S%H369><s%> remedy. <S%H4832><s%>

When the righteous <S%H6662><s%> are in authority, <S%H7235><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> rejoice: <S%H8055><s%> but when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> bears <S%H4910><s%> rule, <S%H4910><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> mourn. <S%H584><s%>

Whoever loves <S%H157><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> rejoices <S%H8055><s%> his father: <S%H1><s%> but he that keeps company <S%H7462><s%> with harlots <S%H2181><s%> spends <S%H6><s%> his substance. <S%H1952><s%>
The king <S%H4428><s%> by judgment <S%H4941><s%> establishes <S%H5975><s%> the land: <S%H776><s%> but he that receives gifts <S%H8641><s%> overthrows <S%H2040><s%> it.
A man <S%H1397><s%> that flatters <S%H2505><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> spreads <S%H6566><s%> a net <S%H7568><s%> for his feet. <S%H6471><s%>
In the transgression <S%H6588><s%> of an evil <S%H7451><s%> man <S%H376><s%> there is a snare: <S%H4170><s%> but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> does sing <S%H7442><s%> and rejoice. <S%H8055><s%>
The righteous <S%H6662><s%> considers <S%H3045><s%> the cause <S%H1779><s%> of the poor: <S%H1800><s%> but the wicked <S%H7563><s%> regards <S%H995><s%> not to know <S%H1847><s%> it.
Scornful <S%H3944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> bring <S%H6315><s%> a city <S%H7151><s%> into a snare: <S%H6315><s%> but wise <S%H2450><s%> men turn <S%H7725><s%> away wrath. <S%H639><s%>

If a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H376><s%> contends <S%H8199><s%> with a foolish <S%H191><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> whether he rage <S%H7264><s%> or laugh, <S%H7832><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> rest. <S%H5183><s%>
The bloodthirsty <S%H582><s%> <S%H1818><s%> hate <S%H8130><s%> the upright: <S%H8535><s%> but the just <S%H3477><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> his soul. <S%H5315><s%>
A fool <S%H3684><s%> utters <S%H3318><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his mind: <S%H7307><s%> but a wise <S%H2450><s%> man keeps <S%H7623><s%> it in till afterwards. <S%H268><s%>
If a ruler <S%H4910><s%> listen <S%H7181><s%> to lies, <S%H1697><s%> <S%H8267><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his servants <S%H8334><s%> are wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
The poor <S%H7326><s%> and the deceitful <S%H8501><s%> man <S%H376><s%> meet <S%H6298><s%> together: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> lightens <S%H215><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> their eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
The king <S%H4428><s%> that faithfully <S%H571><s%> judges <S%H8199><s%> the poor, <S%H1800><s%> his throne <S%H3678><s%> shall be established <S%H3559><s%> for ever. <S%H5703><s%>
The rod <S%H7626><s%> and reproof <S%H8433><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> wisdom: <S%H2451><s%> but a child <S%H5288><s%> left <S%H7971><s%> to himself brings his mother <S%H517><s%> to shame. <S%H954><s%>
When the wicked <S%H7563><s%> are multiplied, <S%H7235><s%> transgression <S%H6588><s%> increases: <S%H7235><s%> but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> their fall. <S%H4658><s%>
Correct <S%H3256><s%> your son, <S%H1121><s%> and he shall give you rest; <S%H5117><s%> yes, he shall give <S%H5414><s%> delight <S%H4574><s%> to your soul. <S%H5315><s%>
Where there is no <S%H369><s%> vision, <S%H2377><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> perish: <S%H6544><s%> but he that keeps <S%H8104><s%> the law, <S%H8451><s%> happy <S%H835><s%> is he.
A servant <S%H5650><s%> will not be corrected <S%H3256><s%> by words: <S%H1697><s%> for though he understand <S%H995><s%> he will not answer. <S%H4617><s%>
See <S%H2372><s%> you a man <S%H376><s%> that is hasty <S%H213><s%> in his words? <S%H1697><s%> there is more hope <S%H8615><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> than of him.
He that delicately <S%H6445><s%> brings <S%H6445><s%> up his servant <S%H5650><s%> from a child <S%H5290><s%> shall have him become <S%H1961><s%> his son <S%H4497><s%> at the length. <S%H319><s%>
An angry <S%H639><s%> man <S%H376><s%> stirs <S%H1624><s%> up strife, <S%H4066><s%> and a furious <S%H2534><s%> man <S%H1167><s%> abounds <S%H7227><s%> in transgression. <S%H6588><s%>
A man's <S%H120><s%> pride <S%H1346><s%> shall bring <S%H8213><s%> him low: <S%H8213><s%> but honor <S%H3519><s%> shall uphold <S%H8551><s%> the humble <S%H8217><s%> in spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
Whoever is partner <S%H2505><s%> with a thief <S%H1590><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> his own soul: <S%H5315><s%> he hears <S%H8085><s%> cursing, <S%H423><s%> and denudes <S%H5046><s%> it not.
The fear <S%H2731><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> brings <S%H5414><s%> a snare: <S%H4170><s%> but whoever puts his trust <S%H982><s%> in the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall be safe. <S%H7682><s%>
Many <S%H7227><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> the ruler's <S%H4910><s%> favor; <S%H6440><s%> but every man's <S%H376><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%> comes from the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

An unjust <S%H5766><s%> man <S%H376><s%> is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the just: <S%H6662><s%> and he that is upright <S%H3477><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> is abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
